solution_line_template: First find how many years the base sentence will be: ${goods_stolen} / 1 year/${base_sentence_per_amount} = <<{goods_stolen}/{base_sentence_per_amount}={base_sentence_years}>>{base_sentence_years} years

Then find how long the increase for the third offense is: {base_sentence_years} years * {third_offense_increase_percent}% = <<{base_sentence_years}*{third_offense_increase_percent}*{percent_factor}={third_offense_increase_years}>>{third_offense_increase_years} years

Then add the third-offense increase and the sentence for resisting arrest to the base sentence: {base_sentence_years} years + {third_offense_increase_years} years + {resisting_arrest_years} years = <<{base_sentence_years}+{third_offense_increase_years}+{resisting_arrest_years}={total_sentence_years}>>{total_sentence_years} years
